Package com.redis.foundation.std

Class FilUtl

java.lang.Object
com.redis.foundation.std.FilUtl
public class FilUtl extends Object
The FilUtl class provides utility methods for copying and zipping files. The goal of this class is to centralize commonly used file operations and to encourage code re-use.

Note: The Apache Commons class library contains a large collection of methods that perform similar tasks. Consult this class library before adding any new methods to this class.

http://commons.apache.org/io/description.html - Basic I/O operations http://commons.apache.org/compress/ - Special compression features

Since:
1.0
Version:
1.0 Jan 4, 2014
Author:
Al Cole

  • Method Details

    • exists

      public static boolean exists(String aPathFileName)
      Convenience method that determines if a path/file name exists in the file system.
      Parameters:
      aPathFileName - Path file name.
      Returns:
      true if it exists and false otherwise

    • generateUniquePathName

      public static String generateUniquePathName(String aPathName, String aPrefix)
      Generates a unique path based on the parameters provided.
      Parameters:
      aPathName - Optional path name - if not provided, then the current working directory will be used.
      aPrefix - Path name prefix (appended with random id)
      Returns:
      A unique path name.

    • generateUniquePathFileName

      public static String generateUniquePathFileName(String aPathName, String aFilePrefix, String aFileExtension)
      Generates a unique path and file name combination based on the parameters provided.
      Parameters:
      aPathName - Path name.
      aFilePrefix - File name prefix (appended with random id)
      aFileExtension - File name extension.
      Returns:
      A unique path and file name combination.

    • getWorkingDirectory

      public static String getWorkingDirectory()
      Convenience method that returns the current working directory/folder.
      Returns:
      Current working directory/folder.

    • getWDPathFileName

      public static String getWDPathFileName(String aRelativeName)
      Combines the current working directory/folder with a relative path file name.

      Invoking getWDPathFileName("resources\\somefile.txt") would produce: "C:\\current\\workdir\\resources\\somefile.txt"

      Parameters:
      aRelativeName - A relative path file name.
      Returns:
      A concatenated string: WD + RN

    • getFileListByPathName

      public static Set<String> getFileListByPathName(String aPathName, boolean aIsAbsolute) throws IOException
      Create a set of file names inside the specified path name.
      Parameters:
      aPathName - Absolute path name
      aIsAbsolute - If true then absolute names will be included
      Returns:
      Set of file names within the path name.
      Throws:
      IOException - File system exception

    • copy

      public static void copy(File anInFile, File anOutFile) throws IOException
      Copies an input file to the output file. In an effort to promote better performance, I/O channels are used for the operations.
      Parameters:
      anInFile - Represents the source file.
      anOutFile - Represents the destination file.
      Throws:
      IOException - Related to stream building and read/write operations.

    • copy

      public static void copy(String anInPathFileName, String anOutPathFileName) throws IOException
      Copies an input file to the output file. In an effort to promote better performance, I/O channels are used for the operations.
      Parameters:
      anInPathFileName - Represents the source file.
      anOutPathFileName - Represents the destination file.
      Throws:
      IOException - Related to stream building and read/write operations.

    • zipFile

      public static void zipFile(File anInFile, File aZipFile) throws IOException
      Compresses the input file into a ZIP file container.
      Parameters:
      anInFile - The file to be compressed.
      aZipFile - The file representing the ZIP container.
      Throws:
      IOException - Related to opening the file streams and related read/write operations.

    • zipFile

      public static void zipFile(String aInFileName, String aZipFileName) throws IOException
      Compresses the input file into a ZIP file container.
      Parameters:
      aInFileName - The file name to be compressed.
      aZipFileName - The file name of the ZIP container.
      Throws:
      IOException - Related to opening the file streams and related read/write operations.

    • zipPath

      public static void zipPath(File aPathFile, ZipOutputStream aZipOutStream) throws IOException
      Compresses the input path file into a ZIP output file stream. The method will recursively process all files and subfolders within the input path file.
      Parameters:
      aPathFile - Identifies the folder to compress.
      aZipOutStream - A previously opened ZIP output file stream.
      Throws:
      IOException - Related to opening the file streams and related read/write operations.

    • zipPath

      public static void zipPath(String aPathName, ZipOutputStream aZipOutStream) throws IOException
      Compresses the input path name into a ZIP output file stream. The method will recursively process all files and sub folders within the input path file.
      Parameters:
      aPathName - Identifies the name of the folder to compress.
      aZipOutStream - A previously opened ZIP output file stream.
      Throws:
      IOException - Related to opening the file streams and related read/write operations.

    • gzipFile

      public static void gzipFile(String anInPathFileName, String aGzipPathFileName) throws IOException
      Compresses the input file into a GZIP file container.
      Parameters:
      anInPathFileName - The file name to be compressed.
      aGzipPathFileName - The file name of the ZIP container.
      Throws:
      IOException - Related to opening the file streams and related read/write operations.

    • ungzipFile

      public static void ungzipFile(String aGzipPathFileName, String anOutputPathFileName) throws IOException
      Decompresses the GZIP file back to its original form.
      Parameters:
      aGzipPathFileName - The GZIP file name.
      anOutputPathFileName - The output file name.
      Throws:
      IOException - Related to opening the file streams and related read/write operations.
